descriptionSet.description: On this image from a lobby card for the Hindi movie "Jurmana", released in 1979, two of the main actors, Amitabh Bachchan and Rakhee Gulzar, stand under a tree, talking to each other. Amitabh Bachchan wears a pair of sunglasses while Rakhee is dressed in a sari. In the lower left section of the image, Amitabh Bachchan can again be seen, dressed in a suit, and smoking.

inscription.text: Sri Lokenath Chitramandir present Jurmana Director Hrishikesh Mukherjee Music R.D. Burman Lyrics Anand Bakshi Producer Debesh Ghosh

description-en: On this image from a lobby card for the Hindi movie "Jurmana", released in 1979, two of the main actors, Amitabh Bachchan and Rakhee Gulzar, stand under a tree, talking to each other. Amitabh Bachchan wears a pair of sunglasses while Rakhee is dressed in a sari. In the lower left section of the image, Amitabh Bachchan can again be seen, dressed in a suit, and smoking. (gs/sp)
related hyperlinks: http://www.naachgaana.com/2011/06/08/underratedforgotten-jurmana-1979/, last accessed 2012-04-06, plot of the movie (sp)

explanatory comments/crosstagging: Plot of the movie from naachgaana: Bachchan plays Inder- a super-rich spoilt brat, a womanizer, and someone who believes in the philosophy that money can buy anything. On a visit to a quiet small town for a construction project, he meets his old college friend Prakash (essayed by Vinod Mehra), who is living a lifestyle that is poles apart from Inder’s own. A few days into his stay he spots Rama (Rakhee in a typical seedhi-saadhi avatar) and gets attracted to her charm, oblivious to the fact that his Prakash has true feelings for her. Just as Inder decides to woo Rama, Prakash gets its inkling- and there ensues a bet. Prakash believes that the simple Rama would in no way get attracted by the charms of the suave and debonair Inder, and would instead teach him a lesson. What Prakash doesn’t realize at that point of time is that it is this presumably harmless bet that would turn their lives upside down. (sp)
